pr_title: Make setting null-valued attributes a no-op, and document that their behavior is undefined.

timeline.body: I don't think we use `@Nonnull`, we default to non-null. We're missing package-info.java to set ParametersNonNullByDefault but that's a better fix I think
timeline.bodyText: I don't think we use @Nonnull, we default to non-null. We're missing package-info.java to set ParametersNonNullByDefault but that's a better fix I think
timeline.bodyHTML: I don't think we use @Nonnull, we default to non-null. We're missing package-info.java to set ParametersNonNullByDefault but that's a better fix I think
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText:
I agree. As I was writing this, I was also wondering why we didn't put the same annotation on the key. :)
Having it set for the package as a whole is much better solution. I'll make it so.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.author: iNikem

timeline.body:
Nit: for simmetry with the other checks
```suggestion
      if (key == null || key.getKey() == null || key.getKey().length() == 0 || value == null ) {
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Nit: for simmetry with the other checks

Suggested change
if (value == null || key == null || key.getKey() == null || key.getKey().length() == 0) {
if (key == null || key.getKey() == null || key.getKey().length() == 0 || value == null ) {
timeline.author: thisthat

timeline.body: should we check that we implement a no-op behavior instead of leaving it undefined?
timeline.bodyText: should we check that we implement a no-op behavior instead of leaving it undefined?
timeline.bodyHTML: should we check that we implement a no-op behavior instead of leaving it undefined?
timeline.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: I went back and forth on this. I'm not really sure which we should do, since we're explicitly saying that behavior is undefined. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: If undefined, don't test for it. Some may consider tests as a kind of documentation.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: that was my thinking as well.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I would argue that the specification says "undefined behavior", i.e. each implementation of the spec can do whatever they prefer, but the OTel SDK has a well-defined behavior. IMHO we should verify that we implement correctly the no-op behavior in every point that touches null attributes.
replies.author: thisthat

replies.bodyText: I've added a test that validates the current behavior, with a clear message that it's not required behavior and would be fine to be changed.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: @thisthat As a C++ dev, I'd say that would be "implementation-defined" behavior, not undefined behavior 😀
replies.author: Oberon00

timeline.message: Make setting null-valued attributes a no-op, and document that their behavior is undefined.
also have the span itself ignore null attribute values
Set the non-null-by-default annotation on the package level for the common code.
Set the non-null-by-default annotation on the package level for the common code.
add no-op validating tests with a caveat
